title: Bertie Plays the Blues
author: McCall Smith, Alexander
snippet: The  day began, as Saturdays always did, with a walk to Valvona  & Crolla with his mother and Ulysses, his younger brother,  whose pushchair Bertie was allowed to propel along  London Street as far as the Broughton Street roundabout. Then his mother took over for the ascent towards Albany  Street.

title: Works of R. L. Stevenson. (Edinburgh edition.) [Edited by Sidney Colvin.]
author: Stevenson, Robert Louis
snippet: The time began to draw near when his father would have returned from the office, and it would be the prodigal's cue to enter. He strolled westward by Albany Street, facing the sunset embers, pleased, he knew not why, to move in that cold air and indigo twilight, starred with street-lamps. But there was one more disenchantment waiting him by the way.

title: A Question of Penmanship. Stories
author: Walford, Lucy Bethia
snippet: His two elder daughters were in the little sittingroom of the lodgings when he returned to Albany Street. It was a glorious evening, and the sun, still shining in a cloudless heaven, penetrated even to the recesses of that gloomy quarter.

title: The novels and tales of Robert Louis Stevenson.
author: Stevenson, Robert Louis
snippet: gal's cue to enter. He strolled westward by Albany Street, facing the sunset embers, pleased, he knew not why, to move in that cold air and indigo twilight, starred with street-lamps. But there was one more disenchantment waiting him by the way.

title: Bertie's Guide to Life and Mothers
author: McCall Smith, Alexander
snippet: "I live in Albany Street," he said. "Do you know it?"
